sentences.en: A mole can undermine the strongest rampart.
sentences.cn: 一只田鼠能毁坏最坚固的堡垒.

sentences.en: Frigid gusts were driving swells in past the mole.
sentences.cn: 寒风阵阵掀起大浪涌过防波堤.

sentences.en: He hailed the Mole to come and warm himself.
He is blind as a mole.
Old men sat along the mole and fished.
sentences.cn: 老人们沿防波堤坐着钓鱼.

sentences.en: Researchers studied moles on those aged between 12 and 50.
sentences.cn: 研究者们研究了12岁到50岁的人身上长的痣。

sentences.en: She had a tiny mole on her cheek.
sentences.cn: 她的面颊上有一颗小黑痣.

sentences.en: That mole is a blemish on his face.
sentences.cn: 那个黑痣是他脸上的缺点.

sentences.en: The authorities believe there is a mole at the Treasury.
sentences.cn: 当局认为财政部里有内奸.

sentences.en: The girl has a tiny mole on her cheek.
sentences.cn: 这女孩在脸颊上有一颗小小的痣.

sentences.en: The mole bored its way underground.
The Mole came and crouched beside him.
sentences.cn: 鼹鼠过来紧偎在他身边.

sentences.en: The Mole fell backwards on the snow from sheer surprise and delight.
sentences.cn: 鼹鼠又惊又喜,仰面朝天地倒在雪地上.

sentences.en: The young girl felt very self - conscious about the large mole on her chin.
sentences.cn: 那位年轻姑娘对自己下巴上的一颗大痣感到很不自在.

sentences.en: Then Tiny wept, and said she would not marry the disaGREeable mole.
sentences.cn: 但是拇指姑娘哭了起来，说她不愿意和这讨厌的鼹鼠结婚。

sentences.en: With a decrease in the mole ratio, volatilization of sulfur decreased rapidly.
sentences.cn: 随着克分子比的降低, 硫的挥发率也急剧下降.

words.tran_cn: 鼹鼠；痣；[水运]防波堤；胎块

trans.tran_en: a small dark furry animal which is almost blind. Moles usually live under the ground.
